intro: Quercus acapulcensis, commonly known as the Acapulco oak, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. It produces acorns that are an important food source for local wildlife. Quercus acapulcensis typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in limestone soils.
